caption: This place, just off Havemeyer, has the best outdoor space. It's quiet and peaceful with a long open area and green decorations. Inside is modern and clean with cool artwork high on the walls.  The food was delicious. Hanger steak was cooked to perfection - true medium rare, seared on the outside pink and bloody in the middle - and delicious with the green topping. The burger and fries also looked delicious.  Relaxed and comfortable, perfect for a chill Saturday on a spring day. Enjoy!
Beautiful outdoor seating, very covid friendly. Had heat lamps, was well spaced, not enclosed in any way.  Food was also delicious. Got the shakshuka flatbread
nice place. but food took a long time to come out. beautiful backyard space though!
The spicy marg was too sweet but the food was amazing.

I live in Florida and wanted to make a small birthday brunch for my son’s 25th. I searched online and called around and landed upon this gem! As soon as I spoke to owner Bill I knew I found the perfect spot. Everything was perfection. He, the manager Claire and server Kellie were beyond accommodating setting the perfect space outdoor and heated in 36 degrees. Food and drinks were delicious and fantastic! Truly fabulous in every way!!
We had a great brunch in a COVID safe and warm outdoor area

We visited for Valentine’s Day 2021 because we LOVE good Mediterranean food and we wanted to have a special outdoor dining experience. This was our first visit and we had high hopes for the food here.  To start, the area is beautiful in the courtyard. There’s hanging ivy and the tables are kept a comfortable distance apart. Perfect.  The issue is the food. We ordered quite a few dishes to share between the two of us, and it was just lacklusted. The pita was freshly made, but the pistachio whipped feta was bland and didn’t have chopped pistachios... they were just placed on top. The Brussels sprouts were okay, the sweet potatoes weren’t that great or delicious either.  When the entree came out, Chicken Under A Brick, came to our table I thought it might salvage the experience. It was okay. Nothing flavorful or exotic.  My boyfriend eats everything middle eastern and Mediterranean so for him to barely touch his plate was just sad.  I really wanted to like this restaurant. The staff and the ambiance were wonderful! Our server was so kind and helpful. But, the menu needs to be inspired.
Awesome place! Can’t say enough about the owner and the staff! Food was great. Bloody Mary’s and Hot Tody’s were on point. Will definitely be back.
Fantastic outdoor dining space. Great heat lamps. The staff are super friendly and the food is 👏

Came here on a Saturday for brunch. Due to COVID, we were there for outdoor dining. They have a lot of heat lamps outside so it's not that bad. I would make sure to bring a blanket or wear thicker pants though because the heat lamps don't really warm up your bottom portion. You can view the menu by scanning a QR code which is good especially during these times. It's a pretty pricey place, but I guess it's on par with Williamsburg prices.  For food, we decided to just share the flatbread and 3 dips and a breakfast bowl. The flatbreads had olive oil and za'atar so they already have a bit of flavor. They came out nice and warm. For the dips, we opted for the hummus, babaganoush, and taramasalata. The hummus was pretty standard. I liked the babaganoush and taramasalata better since they had more flavor.  The breakfast bowl had potatoes, sausage, gravy and two poached eggs. It was really hearty, perfect for a cold afternoon. I wish it came with some bread though because it would have been so good to dip it in the gravy with the runny yolk!  Overall, this place is pretty nice. Love the outdoor space and the heat lamps. The food was pretty good although a bit pricey, but it would be a good splurge once in awhile if you are around the area.

Nice ambiance adjusting to Covid standards and outdoor dining, heating lamps are placed all over. Food and drinks were delicious. I would recommend making a reservation as it can get very busy and with social distancing. Wait staff was nice. I will definitely be back to try more things on the menu.
(Translated by Google) oont  (Original) oont
Swag
Straight up gas food. Hella options. Overall place kinda slaps.
Wonderful food, distanced dining, great heat lamps, and dog friendly.
The food and Décor is amazing.
Amazing atmosphere! Food is great, octopus a plus! I just moved to the neighborhood and loved it!
Delicious and very tasty food with a great customer service to go along with it...
Took almost 2hrs to get food.
Good service, Nice outside area. Food was just ok.
Cute ambiance, decent food.

Had a wonderful brunch for my daughter and her bridesmaids this past Sunday!..your staff is absolutely amazing and treated us like family. I couldn't have asked for a better location!the food is amazing and wow!! delicious cocktails that kept on flowing! Can't wait to go back! Thank you Bill Zafiros and your top notch staff! -Tara Yalango
Amazing food and service and really friendly and attentive staff

Got here by chance, came in with mild expectations and was blown away. The dips with pita was amazing, shell out for all 4!  Squid ink gnocchi were pillows of perfection.  Thank you for the truly satisfying meal
Very cute setting, just ok with their food. Decent service.
Amazing food; great service! 🔥🔥
This was a great spot with a big outdoor patio. I loved the music, the food and the vibes. I'll be back soon!

Read great reviews about this place and had made reservation at Ten Hope for my birthday! As soon as we got there, the waiter was very friendly, let us know that table will be available soon and she grabbed seats for the rest of my party and I. While waiting Renn went and gave us water for the time being. Renn was super great and has an outgoing personality, she really makes people happy and comfortable. She went out of her way to accommodate everyone. I had a great experience, the food was amazing, the wait time for food and drinks did not take that long either, overall I would recommend this place to my friends and family, would definitely come back !

This place has good options if you're vegan and some nice cocktails, but other than that it's mainly overpriced, COMMON food items and drinks. Did not necessarily see why this place considered themselves "Mediterranean" when many dishes on the menu were just burgers and fries.
Too small food portions... Great drinks though.

Overpriced and bland. They charged $19 for a slider (they said it was a "smash burger", but it was so small, you could eat it in 3 bites!).  This place is basic and overcharging either because of the pandemic or because it's Williamsburg.  They think you don't know better - prove them wrong.
Great ambiance and food was great! Cocktails were my favorite part of this dining experience.
Horrible. $18 for a tiny slider (NOT a burger!) that had zero flavor. We had a table of 6 and everyone was disappointed. Overpriced and bland food.  I want a refund. This place should be avoided.
Great outdoor  space with umbrellas on a side street. Very chill and comfortable environment! Salads, burgers and wings!
Friendly service, great atmosphere, great flavors, small portions, big price tag. If you're planning on going to enjoy good food and environment this is a good place.
Garden area was so cute. Our server Renn was the best :)

Made a reservation only to be seated late. Placed our order for food only to be told an hour and a half after we placed it that they were out of the menu items we requested. Sweet server but not enough to make up for the slow service & poor communication from staff.
Great dining experience, especially during quarantine. Outdoor seating area is really nice and spacious, felt very comfortable eating out here. Food was expensive but tasted great.
Great food and an amazing ambiance!! 100% recommend!
good food, good service, zero discrimination
Loved it. Just try it you will not be disappointed!!! Great service too :)
What happened to Mikey, we want answers
Ten Hope is a great restaurant. The service is great, the food is great and I can't wait to go back there again.

The Worst! Been here twice and both times disappointing to say the least. The SERVICE is ATROCIOUS! We waited 45 mins both times to get food. Ketchup took another 15 minutes. This is one of the worst places in Williamsburg that keeps getting high marks. I guess millennials are too wasted to care about wait time here. I’ll pass.

I loved our night at Ten Hope!  A great new option in the neighborhood.  Great energy and I loved the decor.  We ate and drank at the lounge chairs and sofa, great option for a restaurant - easy to talk to everyone you are with.  Started with the dips and flatbread, then ordered the Scallops - AWESOME, and then the Chicken cooked under a Brick - SOO GOOD! Service was on.  Pretty cocktails, really good wine - Loved it!    I highly recommend.

Loving Ten Hope... fav new spot in Brooklyn. I went to a live music Thursday and also to brunch over the weekend (bottomless brunch hellooo!). Really great food, setting and staff. Love it! Thanks guys.
Best pancakes ever!

I liked the ambiance and decor inside and outside. I am sure it’s lovely to sit in a garden area in the summer. Our waitress was pleasant and quick. However food was very disappointing. Tiny portions and expensive. I guess it’s the norm for Williamsburg these days but we were all disappointed in quality and quality of our brunch dishes. I wouldn’t be back.
It was insanely good!!!!

I ordered the lamb shanks. They were pretty delicious but I found the vegetables that came with them a bit firm and their flavor boring/difficult to eat after a while. Also had a few bites of the burger that was pretty tasty. Overall I think the food was good, but don't know if I would go out of my way to come back.

Wow... just wow. Went to the grand opening of Ten Hope BK tonight and I’ll just say it again, wow. I really shouldn’t be surprised as the Chef is Harold Dieterle (Top Chef winner and owned a few awesome restaurants back in the day). Spoiler alert: WOW will be the theme here!  To start, the space is super cool looking. Like a retro deco awesome vibe. Felt very Williamsburg for sure but with a hint of Soho House and a side of hipster.  Went to the bar first and ordered “The Half Royal” and WOW it was so good. I love bourbon and I love blood orange so no surprise here. Followed it up with 1 more cocktail, “Comfortably Numb” and that was... EVEN BETTER!!! I really didn’t even think I’d like it but the sweetness of the rum mixed with whatever that Thai basil black pepper purée was just amazing. The perfect balance.  Sat down and the server was very nice immediately and super knowledgeable about the menu. Was with a friend and ordered the warm flatbreads with dips and seared halloumi with crispy kale to start. The dips were plentiful and WOW, amazing. Each dip better than the next, my favorite was the roasted “broccoflower” with lemon and anchovy, maybe one of my favorite dips ever. Salty, acidic, light feeling, so good! The seared halloumi was great as well but a bit salty for me, my friend was obsessed with the crispy kale, it was very good.  In the meantime before entrees I ordered one of their house made alcoholic sodas, some Gin and citrus concoction in a bottle. It was so freakin refreshing and light, basically a really really good White Claw, WOW! Perfect palate cleanser and just overall an absolute winner.  Onto the entrees... now keep in mind that everything in the restaurant is “shareable” as per our waitress but you prob won’t want to because you’ll want to eat it all yourself haha. I ordered the Seared Diver Sea Scallops and my friend ordered the “chicken cooked under a brick.” Not an exaggeration, my scallops could not have been cooked anymore perfectly and WOW the golden beets and romesco sauce were the perfect accompaniment. 10/10. My friend and agreed and we ended up sharing both (I was very reluctant to) and it was a GREAT choice!!! The chicken could not have been better, for chicken, ya know? The skin was crispy, chicken moist and tender whatever the sauce was, want to say a spicy green sauce almost like Pio Pio was so freakin good, WOW. I could have poured that on anything!  The check came and with it came some cracked pumpkin seed brittle and my oh my... Harold Dieterle and Ten Hope you did it again, WOW!!! Can not believe how good and addicting it was, I wanted 10 more pieces. I don’t even think you can order it if you wanted to, it came on the house, not even on menu.  If anyone has a chance to get to Williamsburg soon, I have a feeling this place will not be that easy to get into in the very near future! Run, don’t walk.
Great place with amazing food and exquisite libations. Definitely worth checking out.
